title: Binomial Distribution: Definition and Derivation
contentHtml: In probability theory, the binomial distribution is a discrete random variable that models the number of successes in a fixed number of independent trials, each with a constant probability of success.

problem.statementHtml: Find the probability of exactly 3 heads in 5 coin tosses, each with a 0.6 probability of being heads.
hints: Hint: Use the binomial distribution formula
problem.solutionHtml:
We can use the binomial distribution formula:

  • Set n = 5 and k = 3
  • Calculate p^k (1-p)^{n-k} = (0.6)^3 (0.4)^2
  • Multiply by \binom{n}{k} = \frac{5!}{3!(5-3)!}
